text.#text:
When evaluating whether a State has substantially

and the State shall make good faith efforts to accomplish substantial

			 section and the State's constitution. In considering whether compliance with
			 the requirements of this section would likely violate the State's constitution
			 or an interpretation thereof by the State's highest court, the

shall consult with the chief executive and chief legal officer of the State

text.#text: In conducting the study under

The effect that
			 stand your ground laws have on rates of violent deaths, including determining
			 whether States that have stand your ground laws have higher rates of violent
			 deaths than States that do not have such laws.

Whether women and minorities are targets of
			 the force authorized by stand your ground laws at a higher rate than the
			 general population.
